verbs.description: impallid (third-person singular simple present impallids, present participle impalliding, simple past and past participle impallided)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To make pallid; to blanch.
examples: Tis the green ſickneſs of the ſoul , that feeding upon coals and puling rubbiſh , impallids all the body to an Hectique leanneſs
